claim: edgar michalowski never play any match at the czechoslovakian international , single or double
resp:
<think>
Okay, I'm trying to figure out whether the claim "edgar michalowski never play any match at the czechoslovakian international, single or double" is TRUE or FALSE based on the provided table. Let me go through this step by step.

First, I need to understand what the claim is saying. It states that Edgar Michalowski didn't participate in any matches (either singles or doubles) at the Czechoslovakian International tournament. So, I'm looking for entries in the table where Edgar's name appears either in "men's singles" or any of the doubles columns ("men's doubles", etc.), and check if those entries correspond to the Czechoslovakian International event.

Looking at the table structure, each row represents a year from 1985 onwards. The columns include "year", "tournament name", "surface", "prize money (approx)", "winner singles men", "runner-up singles men", "men's doubles winner", and "men's doubles runner-up". So, I need to check for each row where the tournament is the Czechoslovakian International.

I'll go through each row one by one:

1. 1985: Tournament is "Czechoslovakian International". Looking at singles men winners: "Poul-erik Hoyer Larsen" and runner-up "Peter Buch". Neither is Edgar. In doubles, winners are "Poul-erik Hoyer Larsen Peter Buch", no Edgar here either.

2. 1986: Tournament is "Czechoslovakian International". Singles men winner is "Andrey Antropov", runner-up "Catharina Andersson" (wait, that's a woman, so probably typo). Doubles winners are "Michal Malý Karel Lakomý", no Edgar.
